Reviews.Title: “Owl Hotel - great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ladyvol
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Owl Hotel April 12 â€“ 18th, 2012. We were on vacation and wanted a central location to experience Amsterdam. Perfect location to walk anywhere in the city. The major museums and concert hall were just a few blocks away, and restaurants & shopping close by. We saw all the city highlights and took a couple of day trips to see tulips, windmills, cheese, etc. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The only â€œless than excellentâ€� item was that the breakfast was not as good as breakfasts we have had in other European cities. It wasnâ€™t bad, just not great. Over all though, I would highly recommend the Owl any time you go to Amsterdam. Take bus 197 from the airport, it is easy!

Reviews.Title: “Family trip to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Caroline1116
Reviews.Content: We visited Amsterdam in February 2011 as part of a midterm break for the kids. The weather really helped sunshine and 2 degrees. The Hotel was particularly family friendly and accommodated a family of 4 comfortably. Breakfast was super and the staff at reception were really helpful. The museums a must - Anne Frank Museum would advise to book online before trip as queues quite long and the Heiniken Museum was even suitable for kids. The highlight for my daughter was the skating rinks 5 euro for an hour included skate hire while we had coffee in adjacent cafe. Will definitely visit Amsterdam again and the Owl Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Barbara K
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Owl for 4 nights. Read the reviews and thanks for advice on bus and directions from airport, excellent. The hotel is in a fantastic location 5 minutes walk from bus stop and into the centre. Nice quiet location and although the room was on the small side, very cozy, comfortable and spotless. The staff were extremely helpful suggesting good little restaurants, for authentic Dutch food try the Pantry, and the best places to visit, the Canal Trip is a must. Breakfast was good, lovely dining room. We thought that Amsterdam was a beautiful city, and the people welcoming and friendly. A big plus being able to fly direct from Inverness. Would most certainly go again, thoroughly enjoyed our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Owl Hotel Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Tim P
Reviews.Content: The Owl Hotel was really easy to find - thanks to the instructions of an earlier reviewer. The bus from the airport Stand B11, (bus number 197) costing â‚¬4 was the best option. The hotel is really nice. The breakfast was good. On our first night we were the only people at breakfast, but it was busy the next two nights. I asked about free wifi at reception to be told that there was no free wifi, but the lady gave me a card which allowed 5 hours for free. This was because we were staying a few nights she said. I was really impressed, it was very nice of her. On our last day we checked out and left our stuff and went for a walk into town, and came back about 2pm. We were offered a drink, which we took a hot chocolate, when I went to pay, we were told this was on the house. Over all - the staff were friendly and helpful. I would strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very pretty and great location!”
Reviews.Author: AJD_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed her one night, 2 adults and 2 kids, and had a lovely room with a beautiful bay window that looked out onto a nice street view of Amsterdam. Very well located (walk to major museums). Breakfast was about average for a 3-star hotel, but the breakfast room is really pretty and the overall ambience is well above average for a small, budget hotel. Only negative (and it's somewhat minor) is that the hotel really should provide free WiFi access. They have one computer downstairs that guests can use free of charge, but if you want to get WiFi in your room, you have to buy these little cards that are keyed to the time you want to stay online (e.g., a few euros for an hour). This is minor stuff and I did not mind the expense of buying a card that much, but most comparable places are providing free Internet these days and they should too.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet outside but noisy inside”
Reviews.Author: beerdrinker2005
Reviews.Content: Great location just one block from Leidseplein (behind Marriott Hotel). 10-15â‚¬ taxi from Central Station, depending on whether driver uses the meter or makes of a fare. Also Trams 1, 2, and 5 run to/from the station for about 3â‚¬ and there is usually space to hold luggage at your feet. Friendly staff offered tourist maps and directions. Unlike the Park Place Hotel, they do not sell tram tickets, but most tams have a person selling various tickets. One Internet PC for guests, worked Ok. Didn't try printi g. Didn't try breakfast on ground floor, near lounge/bar/reading area. Didn't try apparent bar, too may to choose from at LeidsePlein, and they are now Non-smoking (except for coffee shops i believe). Small room (<3x4 meters) with single (smaller than twin) bed with comfortable single pillow and warm blanket. Radiator heator worked well, as did Flatscreen TV over bathroom door, few dozen channels, i cluding National Geographic, CNN qnd BBC, no movies, few radio statons with DJs. Small readng desk near window with view of quiet neighborhood (no vehicle traffic, no tram rumble). Lots of early morning noise from room doors slamming and housekeeping, since rooms are all very close to each other. Carpet minimized noise from overhead furniture movements. Small bath with 1x1.25 meter shower. Excellent hot and cold water, only liquid shower gel and no soap dishes or shelves. Electrical outlet under hqirdryer with EU and Northamerican plugs, probably 220/110. Overall, great location with lots of local restaurants and bars and easy access to museum district. Quiet street even after New Years street fireworks! Very friendly people. ATM at nearby Marriott (careful not to get 100â‚¬ notes that no one wants to accept) No fridge or iron but has hairf Dryer. Maybe top floor room away from stairs/lift/other dors would be quieter in the morning. Thanks for the great tip to find this on TripAdvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: ivytiger
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in Nov 11, my first visit to Amsterdam. I chose this hotel based on the reviews from trip advisor. The location was within walking distance of several desirable attractions. The staff were very friendly and helpful when asked directions.The buffet breakfast was fine and saved us some money instead of eating in a cafe. The room was very clean and relatively quiet. I would definately recommend this hotel for a visit to this city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in a quiet residential neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: rszasz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a quite street in Museum area. You can reach the hotel from Airport with bus 197 for 4Euro rather than 40Euro for taxi. Take the bus at airport at bus stop B11 outside airport exit to the right The trip from airport is app 25 minutes. Get off at stop "Leidseplein " and walk toward Mariott Hotel for 3-4 minutes . Walk on the left alley and in 3-4 minutes you will find the Hotel facing Best Western. I booked a single room which was small app 90-100sqft. The bathroom was full size clean and modern. The breakfast had reasonable selection including boiled eggs, 3-4 kinds of bread to toast, juices, fruits ,yogurts,etc . I was happy that they had very good capuccino. The Hotel is located at 10-15 minutes walk from Van Gough and Rijik Museum and 25 minutes walk to Central Station and Red Light District. I had some trouble to figure out how to use the safety box. All in All I enjoyed this Hotel and I would recommend it to anybody for its central and quite location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Owl Hotel for four nights. The service was second to none. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I stayed in a single room, which was small, but has everything you would need my room ensuite had a shower and no bath which was good for me, but most importantly the room was very clean. There is a comfortable sitting area and a small bar in the hotel. The hotel is situated within walking distance of everything in Amsterdam. Just a five minute walk from the hotel you will find the Keytours excursions centre, which is situated in the fabulous Coster Diamond Museum, which is on Pauluspotterstraat. The Hotel has a good selection of brochures which will tell you whats on in Amsterdam. The Hotel also gave me a 10% discount card for the Blue Boat Company which is the Canal Cruise around Amsterdam, this is again a five minute walk from the hotel just opposite the Holland Casino. Eating out is fantastic, there is a wide range of places to suit all budgets, and the night life near the hotel is great. Where the hotel is is quite so you'll get a good sleep. Now, all bikes in Amsterdam have got right of way, and keep off the bike path! The hotel has a resident cat, which was not an issue for me, but it may be for some. I will be back at the hotel again, it was just fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Good location with the bonus of a quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: rayzel
Reviews.Content: Based on reading reviews on Trip Advisor, we decided to stay at this hotel for 2 nights before embarking on a Netherlands river cruise. We took the city bus from the airport into town, but unfortunately we got off at the wrong stop and ended up wandering around for a while with all of our luggage. All we knew was the address of the hotel and that it was close to Leidesplein. Also, in one of the reviews, they mentioned it was close to the Marriott by Leidesplein. After finally finding the Marriott, they directed us to the Owl which is just behind the Marriott on a back street. Bottom line, if you can't find the hotel ask where the Marriott is and inquire there for the Owl's location. Throughout our stay, the gentlemen at the front desk were wonderful with directions and tourist information. The trams to connect to any location in Amsterdam are around 3 blocks from the hotel at Leidesplein so it is extremely easy to get anywhere in the city from here. The major museums are within walking distance of the hotel at Museumplein. Despite being close to the trams, the hotel is in a quiet residential neighborhood - the best of both worlds. Breakfast was quite adequate and kept us filled until we stopped for a late lunch. The rooms are pleasant, not fancy like the larger hotels, and very clean. If you are looking for a hotel with a good location, clean rooms and pleasant staff, this is where you should stay when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Tillac
Reviews.Content: We have just spent three nights at the Owl Hotel for a friends' reunion. The hotel is family-run and consequently has a lovely, friendly atmosphere with extremely welcoming staff at the front desk. The rooms are simply furnished but spotless. We had a bath with great shower over it. The breakfast in the morning is typically Dutch, with one or two additions - really good with great coffee. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to be within reasonable reach on foot of the main museums etc., in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulmaddock
Reviews.Content: Just like to say that this hotel is very clean & the staff were more than helpful to any questions or needs we had, we had a room that was bright & adequate for what we needed, nothing fussy just a nice sized double bed although it was two large singles pushed together & a gap did appear in the middle at certain times if you know what i mean haha! no problems though.....more than enough room to walk around the bed & a modern looking clean bathroom with a shower (no bath) but again no prob's, one thing i will say is watch the step as you go into the bathroom ...especially at night, all i can say is my girlfriend is still laughing now at my ...lets say my little trip ;o) ...beware stubbed toes & headbuttin walls with hangover is not a thing to have on your wishlist!!! 'trust' ..... Breakfast was typically continental ..fresh & tasty & as much as you like! happy days, Oh they do have a lovely cat called Disney that owns the the hotel ..well if u know cats ;) ...but don't worry she doesnt nick your food if your not looking..... just on general patrol & keeping everything in order, Its about a 5 min tram ride into city centre ...20 min walk... or 2 million euros for a cab ;) ...don't get cabs they are a rip off ..20 euros for a 20 min walk ...naaaa! oh & you'd sit in traffic for 15 mins ( no brainer) Overall i'd recommend this hotel for sure, good service .. clean.. & at a decent enough rate compared to other hotels we looked at.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: wallycat_9
Reviews.Content: We totally enjoyed the Owl Hotel from the very friendly staff to the cat that lives in the charming sitting room and garden. It's in a very quiet neighborhoodm but the Van Gogh Museum, the Riijksmuseum, and the Leidseplein with a multitude a restaurants are a short walk away. The rooms are not fancy, but they are clean and functional. A great hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: TJB2094
Reviews.Content: 5 mins walk from Leidsel Square, a great social hub of bars, restaurants, theatres and city nightlife. Far enough away to be quiet though. Just what you need for a city break...with friendly helpful staff and a nice simple Dutch breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel would stay again”
Reviews.Author: JuliePotter
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. The room and bathroom were clean along with the common areas. We booked a family room which was double booked so had a "zed bed" put in a double room which was fine for our daughter (14 years). The room was cheaper so we saved a bit of money! The breakfast was plentiful and even included boiled eggs which made a lovely change. The staff were all very friendly and when we phoned before arrival about which bus to take from the airport we were given good advice. Although the hotel is on a side street everything was walkable and you felt safe, even at 11.30pm at night. We would definately stay again and would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Amsterdam at the Owl”
Reviews.Author: Coddy35
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival in Amsterdam at Central Station, we were a little unsure of where the hotel was but after investigation we took a very crowded tram 5 and departed about ten minutes later just a few minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel was located on a quiet side street, and when we entered we were greeted enthusistically by the host (whomever was on the front desk was very friendly all three days) who gave us some tips for touring the city and an outlined map to some of the attractions we hoped to see. Depsite being on the "outskirts" of the city centre, we soon found that getting around would not be diificult at all. We were a short walk from a tram stop, hop-on-hop-off bus and canal stops, and within easy walking distance to the major museums, the Leidseplein, the Heineken Experience. and Anne Frank's House (and about a 30 minute walk to the Red Light District). The rooms were small but comfortable with a flat screen television (with many English/American programming) standard. Breakfast was complimentary with a very nice selection of food in a beautiful dining area (it is also possible to eat in an outdoor terrace area). Another nice touch was free internet access on a computer on the main floor, which was great for those of us that do not carry these devices with us when we travel. Overall, a very enjoyable three days at the Owl and we would definately recommend it to other travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wordscriber
Reviews.Content: A nice, quiet little hotel. Great location for visiting the two main museums (Rijks and Van Gogh) and catching the dinner cruise on the canals. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: hkhappygal
Reviews.Content: Just stayed in The Owl Hotel for 4 nights. Before the trip, I have googled about many hotels in Amsterdam and have read few hundreds of comments on various websites. Maybe because it is in the month of August, many of the hotels were full (i checked 6 weeks before the actual traveling date) and the remaining ones cost around 180 to 250 euro per night. So the 132 euro (including all taxes) of the owl hotel seemed like a good deal, plus with all the favorable comments in the trip advisor, I thought it would be a safe bet. To go to Owl hotel from airport, you can get bus no. 197 from bus stop B11 ( outside the airport towards the right ) and get down in the stop 'Leidseplein'. Bus fare is 4 euro per person. After you get off, walk towards Marriott hotel. When you are in front of the Marriott, take the left lane down and the hotel is facing Best Western Hotel on your left hand side. It will be a 4 -5 mins walk. We arrived at 10:30 am and since the hotel was not full, the lady checked us in immediately. Check in was smooth and efficient. The room was about 20 sq m with two single beds pushed together. There was a small closet and desk and chair. The room was small as mentioned by other travelers but at least it was not claustrophobic. We had the view of the back garden and it was rather soothing. There was a small tv (22 ") on the wall and a hair dryer in the toilet. No toiletries aside from soap and shower cap. Beds were comfortable and linens were clean. However, there was no air conditioning in the hotel, so if you arrive in the hot summer days (not that many in Amsterdam) , there might be a problem. We were in room 54 ( 4th floor) and unfortunately the entrance light and the table light didn't work, so we had only 2 small lights above the bed and the room was kind of dark. However, it didn't bother us as we were out the whole day and we only slept in the room at night. I love the fact that the hotel is 'smoke free' so non smokers like me will not be disturbed by stinks and smells of cigarettes and hemp. They also have an elevator so if you have heavy baggage, there will not be a problem. Breakfast was included and there were 3 cold cuts, slices of cheese, cereals, milk, orange juice and a coffee / tea machine. There were slices of bread and some fruits and also boiled eggs. Nothing extravagant but enough to start the day. It would probably be ideal if they could have a Nespresso machine ( seems pretty standard in other hotels) rather than the current one they have because the coffee is quite awful. ( you get weak american coffee even when you select espresso) Location wise, the owl hotel is on the quiet side of the city centre and its close to Van Gogh museum and Rijksmuseum (about 10 mins walk). The amsterdam casino is a 5 mins walk and to the left the casino, there are many restaurants. There is a canal cruise right next to the casino. Going to the city centre Dam area, it will be around 10 mins tram ride. We really liked the location because it was away from the hustling and bustling of the 'Dam' and 'Red light district' and central station and yet close to tram stops and you can walk everywhere. The only negative thing is that the wifi internet cost 3 euro an hour and you need to buy a card in the lobby. They do have one pc in the lobby for guests use. All the people we met in the reception were friendly and could give good recommendation of restaurants. We went to one indonesian restaurant near the hotel which was recommended by the young guy at the night reception and it was very good (not authentic but very tasty). Overall, I do like the owl hotel especially its location though its price is a bit high for a 3 star hotel. If it is within 100 euro then it will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: colentina
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 3 night stay in this hotel situated centrally but in a quiet area. The staff is very nice and friendly. The rooms are small (not a problem for us) and clean.The breakfast was good and served in a nice, clean room. It was a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly experience”
Reviews.Author: firelaw
Reviews.Content: You will find this hotel well situated and you can walk to anywhere you want to go. Small rooms, but typical European. Front counter staff exceptional and a good buffet/continental breakfast facility. Pleasant little courtyard to sit and relax. Free in house internet computer. For convenience and friendliness, this is a good choice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Lucky Second Choice”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamBella
Reviews.Content: I must admit this was our second choice as the first hotel I tried (having of course read T.A.) was booked up, but certainly have no regrets. I've always liked owls and our recent 3 night stay at the Owl Hotel did nothing to alter that. It is a small hotel in a wonderfully convenient location - clean, quiet and very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful and all spoke perfect English. There was a good choice of cereals, different kinds of bread along with fruit, cheese, cold meats and boiled eggs, for breakfast. We were lucky with the weather and were able to take advantage of the small garden to sit and have a quiet drink after a day's heavy sightseeing. We will certainly make the Owl Hotel first choice for our next visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: Shell186262
Reviews.Content: We had booked into another hotel which was disgusting and dirty so refused to stay there. We went into lots of hotels which were fully booked, when we got to the Owl Hotel they were fantastic they shuffled things around so they could give us a room. The place was lovely and clean, the staff very friendly and the breakfast was great. It is situated in a lovely and quite location and close to all transport. I would recommend anyone to stay there and will certainly stay there again. Thank you for a fantastic stay

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, staff very helpful”
Reviews.Author: romurphy
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 4 night stay at the owl Hotel. Breakfast was really good and coffee was great which isn't always the case in Hotels. Hotel was very convienent to museums etc and Airport bus stopped very close by. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our choice.”
Reviews.Author: sukiro
Reviews.Content: We chose the Owl Hotel for our five days in Amsterdam before our cruise and were very happy with the hotel. We arrived at 9:00am, after an overnight flight, and were told that the room was ready so we could have it immediately - that is such a nice feeling to be able to get settled in after travelling for so long. The woman on the front desk told us to go and get settled and then come back down and she would give us a map and help us get our bearings and point out some of the main sites in the city. As everyone has said the rooms are small and basic but they have everything you need and are clean. I wanted another pillow and ran into the housekeeper who dropped everything and went and got me one. Everyone on the staff was very friendly and helpful and were always available to answer questions and give directions. I was impressed with the breakfast - I admit I'm not a big breakfast person but I thought there was a very good variety of foods available. It's good to be able to start the day with breakfast in your hotel and not have to go out searching for it. The lounge and backyard were very nice and I'm sure if we were staying longer we might have made better use of them. I also appreciated the free computer/internet and made use of it several times. The location was very good. It was about a 5 minute walk to the Leidesplein and there was a grocery store a few blocks away, which was handy. We didn't use the trams during our stay because everything was so easily reached by walking. We didn't hear any noises from any of the other hotel guests and only one night were we aware of people in one of the backyards behind the hotel - our window was open. We had a good stay in Amsterdam and a large part of that was feeling at home at the Owl Hotel. I would highly recommed it to anyone who wanted a reasonably priced, clean, centrally located hotel with excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: BethUSA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Owl for 4 nights in June, on 2 separate occasions. As reported in other reviews, the rooms are on the small side, but when there is so much to see in the city, it didn't matter. It was a clean, safe, quiet place to sleep. Breakfast was modest, but included in the rate and a great way to start your day. You do have to pay for the internet, but there is 1 common computer that was available to use, sometimes with a short wait time. Staff were fantastic - very friendly & knowledgeable. A great resource when touring the city. My room was clean and I never had a problem with the water in the shower. Also, the hotel is easy to reach from the airport via a bus, so much easier than taking a train from the airport to the centraal station and then taking a tram and then walking....ugh! If you are not looking for the biggest room and best breakfast, you will love the Owl.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, walking distance to Leidseplein and Museumplein”
Reviews.Author: Bonn_87
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and good value with the breakfast included. Wonderful courtyard. We walked all over Amsterdam from here. Very close to Vondelpark (less than a block away). The front desk is very friendly and helpful. Close to all the museums. Good walk to Anne Frank's House. Very quiet location. Our room faced the courtyard but I would think that either side would be quiet. Access to lobby computer with internet. There was an elevator. Very secure--buzzed in by the front desk. You can take Tram 1, 2, or 5 to get here from Central Station but after that you can walk everywhere, or at least we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: wanderer31310
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here on two different dates: one prior to a cycling trip and one on completion and we were very satisfied with the service, rooms and general location. All of the staff were very accomodating and helpful. The rooms were small but very clean and comfortable. The breakfast area looking out through the large windows into a secluded courtyard was a real treat. We were close to museums, trams, a park and good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for museums, very quiet”
Reviews.Author: director15
Reviews.Content: The Owl Hotel is very well located for walking to the Rijks and Van Gogh Museums. It is about 2 1/2 blocks from the Leidseplein which features numerous restaurants and tram stops. The Owl is on a very quiet street. Although the rooms could stand a bit of sprucing up, our room was comfortable and clean. Breakfast is served in their small dining room and the outdoor garden is a great place to relax and have a drink after a day of touring before setting out for one of many, many restaurants in Leidseplein for dinner. We have stayed at the Owl on previous trips and have recommend it to friends, all of whom have been very pleased with it. It is not a fancy, "American" hotel, but if you like to stay in small, friendly, clean accommodations, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, very adequate”
Reviews.Author: Atlanta3452
Reviews.Content: I had a small single room - it was clean and quiet. The price is not cheap- 97 euro, but it was a good location- easy access to trams, walking distance to the museum complex. Breakfast was good and nice opportunity to meet other guests. One computer with free access - so time is limited. Staff was quite friendly- night staff is less friendly. It was a challenge finding a place in Amsterdam- places fill up quickly. This was on a quiet street, easy to find. I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hugh-J-Pension
Reviews.Content: Very well situated near transport etc but quiet area. We arrived way too early but were made very welcome. The entire property is beautifully maintained and clean. Staff are particularly good,cheerfull and always helpfull .Rooms well equiped and have nice modern bathrooms with top quality power showers .Breakfast buffet fresh & topped up regularly. Only thing missing is Tea & Coffee in the rooms. Highly recommended ,we would not hesitate to return to the Owl.

Reviews.Title: “A Simple Silent and a Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Imransiddiqui82
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Amsterdam to attend a conference and so our official authorities booked Hotel OWL for all the attendees. There are bunch of other hotels in the same vicinity and it was one in the middle. The hotel staff are very supportive and pleasant, always ready to help. Dutch people are very convenient in english so there is absolutely no problem in talking to them or asking any help. I received a small single room and it was on the top floor. The lift is too small and can accommodate only 2-3 people in a single go. The room was neat and clean with attached bathroom. The bed was too small just enough for a single person. No free internet, you have to pay. Breakfast is included which is nice and you can start your day with a typical light dutch breakfast. A nice hotel for a budget traveler and for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but expensive!”
Reviews.Author: KLJK
Reviews.Content: Great location (within 10 minute walk from Van Gogh, Rijks, Canal tours, and restaurants) and very easily accessible from airport and train station (1 connection, no transfers). Good and fresh continental breakfast provided with a beautiful patio to enjoy it on! Staff were helpful and accomodating and rooms were immaculate. Downside was that the price of the rooms were very expensive for what you are getting (and maybe that's just Amsterdam?)...

Reviews.Title: “Could be much better”
Reviews.Author: ukrainian_guy
Reviews.Content: Small hotel near one of the main entertainment areas. Rooms are quite small and dark, but clean. Personnel is very friendly, however services are not brilliant. Wi-fi is not free (you have to buy Internet card to use it in your room); breakfast is too modest and monotonic. Shower is one of the main problems as water is sometimes trickling

Reviews.Title: “Busy amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: PushkarNSW
Reviews.Content: The Owl hotel is very elegant. It looks great from the outside and the reception area and breakfast room is very quaint. The breakfast is included in the price...132 euros. It had a fairly good choice of breakfast foods. Our room faced on to the garden which was light up at night and looked like a fairyland. The room itself was quite small..only enough room for the bed and a small table either side. They had a good selection of English tv stations. The owl is very close to the tram. Catch either a 1,2 or 5 from central station and get off at leaderspein. The hotel receptionist are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy-you'd never guess you're a stone's throw from Leidseplein”
Reviews.Author: gp2008Mumbai
Reviews.Content: The Owl is a small boutique kind of hotel with a very charming cosy feel. We arrived there for a spring break and were largely satisfied with our experience. Note, ALL Amsterdam hotels are very expensive , so while we felt that the $132 price tag was a bit much, it certainly compared well to other hotels in Amsterdam. Location- The location of the Owl is brilliant. It is located within a 5 minute walk to Leidseplein -the buzzing entertainment district, but its so quiet in the lane of the Owl, you'd never guess. From the airport, a quick ride by the 197 bus brings you to the Marriott, from which it is a convenient 2 min walk. You're also 5 minutes away from the Museums and the Vondelpark. It has a lovely garden to sit in on a warm day Service- Good very friendly on the whole.Initially, they told us we wouldnt get a room until noon when we reached around 8 am , but later the lovely Marina sorted us out into one immediately. We were relieved not to wait after a long flight. On our way out too, they gladly checked up timings of the 197 Bus for us. Generally very helpful with maps , travel directions etc Breakfast- a bit repetitive- toast, cheese , cereal and fruit everyday but wholesome. Rooms- Our room (double) was a bit smaller than expected, and the bathroom absolutely tiny. But we are generally not fussy about it since we tend to be out most of the time,but this maybe a challenge for people with children or intending to take it easy indoors.Rooms were cleaned regularly. Ours overlooked the garden, which was quite nice. I'd definitely recommend this hotel especially if you have a packed itinerary and dont want to stay indoors much. The location and the value for its price are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to recommendations”
Reviews.Author: goinglightly1
Reviews.Content: A very good value hotel in excellent location for Museum area, Vondelpark, Concertgebouw (free lunchtime rehearsal concert on Wednesdays) and shopping, with good bus, canal and tram connections nearby for getting about. Bus from airport and tram from Central Station stop very nearby. Our top floor room wasn't huge, but perfectly adequate, very comfortable bed and the room and bathroom were both spotless. Nice and quiet too. Excellent breakfast. What really made the place for us, like most guests, was the staff, from chambermaid to management, who could not have been more pleasant and helpful. We wouldn't hesitate to go back, not least to be able to sit out in the delightful garden. We did find the directions ("just behind the Marriott hotel) a bit vague on arrival; easiest way is, facing the front of the Marriott, go down the street to its left and keep bearing left.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant return visit”
Reviews.Author: micdev
Reviews.Content: As i expected it would be, my recent stay here was just as good as my previous visit last year.Checkin was fast with a minimum of hassle & paperwork. My room was at the front of the hotel but i had no problems whatsoever with noise from the street outside.The room itself was small but clean, warm & comfortable with a good bed, wall mounted tv, wardrobe, dresser, safe etc but no minibar, iron or tea/coffee facilities.The bathroom had shower enclosure, shower gel, hairdryer & plenty of towels. Breakfast again, was good, continental style with plenty of choice from a cold buffet. The small bar at the end of reception with it's comfortable sofa seating was a great place for a quiet, chilled out beer or a coffee. The reception staff (along with the location) are one of the things that made me book the Owl again . Very friendly & genuinely welcoming, they were full of great advice & very knowledgeable on anything i needed to know, not just about the city but also further afield. It's probably worth mentioning that the stairs in the hotel are quite steep & a little bit narrow but there is a small lift, so that need not be a problem. To get to the hotel from the airport i used the connexxion airport shuttle minibus which cost 15.50 euros per single trip & left me off right outside the hotel.Another (& cheaper)option would have been to use one of the regular connexxion buses from the airport to the Leidseplein. On this visit i got out & about quite a bit without ever straying too far away from the hotel.The many bars & restaurants of the Leidseplein & Museumplein are just minutes walks away from the hotel & the Jordaan district(worth visiting are Cafe Tuin & De Nieuwe Lelie bars) is also just a short walk away.Also nearby are De Zotte & T'Arendsnest bars.Vondelpark & the Rijksmuseum are also very close by, so it's possible to visit many of the major attractions of Amsterdam without ever being more than just a short walk away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I need”
Reviews.Author: TorontoBobby
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Owl three times now and each time have been delighted. I like the location--a quiet, calm street close to the Leidseplein one way and the Museumplein another. The staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast is good. There is no wifi but a free internet computer just off the breakfast room which comes in handy. In good weather you can relax in their back garden. If you're looking for deluxe accommodations this isn't the place for you, but in a city that can be rather dodgy where hotels are concerned, the Owl is downright refreshing. I'll continue to go there on all future visits to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “The fantastic reviews are 100% accurate!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bindhi34
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of the reviews it had received on Trip Advisor and they were right on the money. When we landed in Schipol Airport, we had one of the KLM employees tell us it was a great hotel, so that definitely made me happy. The room is very clean and has everything you need unless you plan on spending your vacation in the room and not outside in Amsterdam. Very clean, although small bathroom, but not inconvenient. Excellent shower. TV was great and I found the bed to be extremely comfortable. THe breakfast buffet was delicious with great service. I especially liked the quick and delicious coffee machine down there. AND it is a safe area and within perfect walking distance of all of Amsterdam. The Museumplein is within 5 minutes walking, the Leidseplein is within 5 minutes walking...and then everything else is manageable in such a tourist friendly place. I walked from the hotel all over Amsterdam and only took a bus to and from the airport, although the public transporation is so great there it would've been easy to navigate and take buses instead. All in all, worth far more than the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, hotel so so”
Reviews.Author: Bokidemus
Reviews.Content: + Location is perfect, hotel is in the central area of the city, in a quite street near the Best Western and Marriot hotel. Best getting to hotel is to take bus 197 from the airport (costs 4 â‚¬/person and you have to have exact amount of money), you get off at Leidseplein, you will see Marriot hotel, walk towards it, Owl hotel is right behind it. The hotel is walking distance to two most important museums, Rikjsmuseum and Van Gogh museum, only 5-10 minutes walk. Also shopping areas, nightlive, restaurants etc. you can easily reach by walking. The city is amazing. We walked two days and didn`t use once bus nor tram even though the weather was cold and rainy. + The hotel was clean and neat, our room was nro 36 with a nice view to the garden, maybe a bit small, but still had everything we needed. During our stay we also made a new friend with the owner`s cat "Disney". - The breakfast was a bit disappoiting, many said that it was great, that was one of the reasons we picked this hotel, because we always stay in the hotels with good breakfast. For my husband it was ok, but for me very little to choose from ( I am vegan). - The cleaning lady started her day always around 8 a.m. and woke us up on both days during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: JFigli
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for the weekend, and it was great. It's so close to the city centre and to the museums. We've only used the tram once, but only because it was freezing, you can walk everywhere. The breakfast is ok and the rooms are not that small. I'd definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly small hotel close to Leidseplein.”
Reviews.Author: LaurenceYork
Reviews.Content: Our family of seven stayed at the Owl Hotel for a weekend. We were visiting the Netherlands from England to celebrate the "Sinterklaas" with our Dutch family. The hotel staff were EXTREMELY friendly and accommodating and did everything they could to make our stay an enjoyable one. During the day on the Saturday we used a public area of the hotel for a family reunion of 15 people, which involved noise and mess (from the wrapping paper), and the hotel staff were really kind to let us do this. Everything in the hotel was very clean and the breakfast was fine. There is a nice garden which would be perfect in summer (it was snowing on our trip). I have just two suggestions for improvements. The first is the wireless Internet, which costs 3 euro for 1 hour and 10 euro for 5 hours. It would be far simpler to pay one amount for the entire stay, or to have free WiFi. The second comment is about the 'twin' rooms - they are not really proper twin rooms. I shared a twin room with my brother. There are two single beds, but they are right next to each other - there is no gap between them, and no way to move them. If you were sharing a twin room with someone who wasn't a close relative or friend (for example two colleagues on a business trip), you probably wouldn't want to have this arrangement. Despite this I would definitely recommend the Owl Hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “good quiet location near vondel park”
Reviews.Author: jimbo084
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the owl on two occasions when visiting amsterdam.It's a nice friendly run hotel with helpful staff, quiet location yet a stroll to the centre.I will stay there again on my next visit to Amsterdam, because I am familiar with the hotel, it's good service, I am happy to go there

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: srijayjs
Reviews.Content: This is a cozy and nice hotel. We felt we were in the midst of friends. The staff were very friendly and always smiling. The front office staff received us with such warmth that the initial reactions were very positive. The rooms were good, though small as is the norm in most of Europe. The breakfast was adequate and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for non-luxury experience”
Reviews.Author: bookmama22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Owl Hotel at the end of October. Although admittedly the room was the smallest I have ever been in, the hotel offers a good value. It is spotless, the staff is extremely helpful, the location is ideal, there is a decent, basic breakfast included, there is a free computer in the lobby for guest use, there is an outdoor garden and a lounge for guests to use.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome, well located - wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Shippers
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant little hotel where you are sure to get a cheerful welcome and all the help you need to enjoy your stay. Rooms are vey pleasant with the big advantage of peace and tranquility, as the hotel is located in a very quiet neighbourhood. Despite this it's not far from tram and bus stops and quite an easy walk into Central Amsterdam and (the big deal if you are an art lover) less than 5 minutes from the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum. We also found a selection of nice eating places nearby (would recommend the Katika (Indonesian) and Dionysos (Greek) both in Overtoom, 2 blocks away). Some decent if upmarket shopping in the neighborhood too. All in all, would thoroughly recommend staying here, particularly if you value a family atmosphere over a faceless corporate one.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room & Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Gchezmoi
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 8 nights in October 2010. The location is safe. As it is autmun, the trees around the hotel was all painted red. Really pretty! The hotel is a short distance away to Van Gogh museum and Rijksmuseum. It is also a short walk to Leidseplein, just need to pass by Marriot Hotel and cross the road. From Leidseplein, it is a short tram ride to the central station. Excellent location! The hotel serves hot breakfast buffet with different breads, boiled eggs, juices, coffee, hot chocolate, biscuits, fruits, etc. Good breakfast to start the day! My room is facing the inner courtyard. It is clean, very peaceful and quiet for a good night sleep. You can also surf the net, located just next to the breakfast area. There is also a cabinet full of owls figurines. I like to collect owls figuines too. So, I was really happy to see the hotel's collection. The staff are really helpful. I remembered this lady who I met on my first day. I was jet lagged and having a terrible headache. As my room was not ready, she gave me a paracetamol and told me to rest at the lounge area with hot tea. I really appreciate her very much! She was also the one that arranged for my transport with Connexxion shuttle on my last day to the airport . She was really professional. Her boss should really value her! If I am in Amsterdam again, I will stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with gracious staff and wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: z0ma
Reviews.Content: A small hotel located in the museum district with charming facilities. Gracious, helpful staff. Clean rooms. Very low key but great location. Breakfast more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “the best 3 star hotel in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: itay0304
Reviews.Content: We stay 3 night un the hotel Excellent location Great team, helped any questions. Full contribution for payment. the best 3 star hotel in Amsterdam's.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely part of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LenJanice
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay, hotel room on the small side but bathroom very well appointed. This is a family run operation, breakfast was good, staff friendly and very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but that's all it is.”
Reviews.Author: BtnJoe
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on here, and having several bad hotel experiences in the 'Dam, we decided to spend a few quid extra to make sure we got a nice hotel. We paid 260euro for two nights, which to us is a lot of money and could get you two nights at the Grand in Brighton for the same price, so maybe I was expecting a bit too much. It is a nice hotel, but that's all it is. The room was fairly clean although there was a conspicuous stain on the wall, shower was nice and clean, but it was all very basic. Breakfast was adequate, cold meats and cheese, boiled eggs, etc. To be honest, the staff were really nice, but sometimes it was bordering on over-nice, if there is such a thing. The location is good, 5 mins walk from Leidseplein and Museumplein, 2 mins from Vondelpark, 20 mins to Dam Square, but if you there for a party( which I suspect you are!), then maybe this hotel is not for you. It was full of middle-aged Americans who all seemed to be in bed by 10pm. All in all, a pleasent stay, but overpriced for what it was, and over-rated reviews, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Needmygps
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in a clean double room with large bath. Quiet street close to town center, during world cup games. Staff is helpful and free breakfast is in a nice sunny room. We would stay again, more charming then chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: SydneyBridge
Reviews.Content: When we chose our hotel, we wanted something as close to the city as possible, with a lift and at a reasonable cost. Owl Hotel fitted all three perfectly. I had to phone from Australia and formed a very good impression from this phone call - the man was friendly and helpful and language was no problem (I do not know any Dutch!). This hotel is close to the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum, close to restaurants in and around Leidens sq. We began to learn the tram system and this was also accessible. The rooms were comfortable and clean. Breakfast was a continental buffet. When we arrived, we met the man who had spoken to us on the phone, and we found that all the staff were friendly and helpful. Unfortunately it was wet weather so we could not take advantage of the lovely garden area outside. In all, we were very happy with it and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect mid-range place to stay in Amsterdam for a quiet trip!”
Reviews.Author: Irunbklyn
Reviews.Content: They say a good nights rest is hard to find in Amsterdam, so I guess it's ironic that the place to sleep is the Owl Hotel. Off the main streets in a cozy little square, the Owl is charming, clean (we're talking Dutch standards of cleanliness, which are HIGH) and staffed by delightful people. The rooms are small...cozy...so if you're a truck loving, suburban living, chain hotel fan from Houston, TX you might not like this place....but this is Amsterdam and space is at a premium. Also, this is not a party hotel so don't expect that either. Close to everything: the park (lovely for a run...3.3km around for you runners out there), lively street/shopping, museums, etc. I would expect to pay a lot more for the location. Breakfast is great. Traditional Dutch ham and cheese on bread and additionally yogurt, hard boiled eggs, juice and cereal. Nicely done Owl Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't ask for friendlier staff”
Reviews.Author: Al_and_Sali
Reviews.Content: We just made an overnight trip from Paris to Amsterdam. Based on an Internet search, we chose the Owl Hotel which was convenient to all the major museums and downtown but still in a very quiet neighborhood. Our room was of a reasonable size (not American size but no where as small as many I have stayed in in Europe). The room was very clean and the beds comfortable. The bath was clean and functional. Breakfast was complete and healthy. But, what made our stay so easy was the cheerful and accommodating staff. Everyone whom we spoke to took the time to be friendly and helpful, from restaurant suggestions to printing out a document from my flash drive. It made a very pleasant stay. P.S., If you go there, don't forget to say hello to our friend who wandered around the lounge while we enjoyed our before dinner drinks.

Reviews.Title: “A wise choice”
Reviews.Author: Holly22
Reviews.Content: We loved the Owl. It was clean,quiet, and comfortable, with a free computer to use for those of us who don't bring our own.Our room on the top floor had a little corner turret that I loved! The breakfast buffet had a delicious array of choices, and a great cappucino machine! The staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly--they also saved us money by recommending the Shiphol bus for 4 euro instead of the airport shuttle--very convenient. The location is near the Vondelpark, in a nice area within easy walking distance to the museums.

Reviews.Title: “First excellent hotel experience in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: WilliamCG
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels in Amsterdam, ranging from the Amsterdam Hilton to shabby two-star hotels that I won't even mention, but the Owl Hotel was by far the best Amsterdam hotel experience of all! Very unassuming, but perfectly located and with an extremely friendly and savvy staff (day and night). Although parking in Amsterdam is ultra-expensive these days, it was nice to be able to park right in front of the hotel at any moment of the day. We will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly and Helpful Family Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KTandTA
Reviews.Content: Really nice quaint hotel in quiet location but only a 10 minute walk to restaurants, bars and shops. Room very small but clean and well maintained. Breakfast nice, constantly replenished buffet style. Definitely recommended, we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly professional staff, wonderful quality breakfasts, good sized rooms, great location near to shops and clubs.”
Reviews.Author: BletchleyCat
Reviews.Content: We have visited Amsterdam once a year for the last ten years. We found this hotel in 2007 and have stayed here ever since. This year we arrived mid morning and expected to have to wait till the afternoon to get into the room. However we were asked to wait just a few minutes and then were able to get into our room. This made a very pleasant start to our holiday. The hotel is a few minutes walk away from the tram lines and also a few minutes walk away from the shops, restaurants and nightlife at Leidseplein. The hotel is medium sized, with a small lift which was quite adequate for the two of us and our luggage. The rooms are good sized, particularly for city hotels, with decent lighting and flat screen television. In common with most European hotels they don't supply a tea/coffee maker so we bring a kettle. We have now stayed both in the back and front of the hotel, either side is very quiet at night. Both room and en-suite bathroom are very clean, the housekeeping is quick and efficient. There is a very convenient safe in the room. The breakfasts are of very good quality, slices of Dutch cheese, ham, numerous varieties of bread, and crispbreads, boiled eggs, cereals, fruit juice etc. The breakfast room is light and airy and you can go out to have breakfast in the garden. However although the whole hotel is non-smoking people can and do smoke in the garden, even over other people's breakfasts. There is also a small bar next to the reception where you can get both alcoholic and soft drinks and tea and coffee. There is one PC next to the breakfast room where you can access the internet for free, otherwise there is wi-fi throughout the hotel but you have to buy vouchers to use this. If this had been free I would have given the hotel maximum scores for value. Perhaps the best thing about this hotel are the friendly staff who go out of their way to assist, whether it is helping you to find a city location or listening carefully to your halting attempts to speak Dutch, (they all speak excellent English), and at your invitation being kind enough to help with the pronunciation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: lamalama6
Reviews.Content: The location is good: central and close to some museums, boat rides, shopping/entertainment area Leidseplein, and Vondelpark, and yet located in small and relatively quiet street. The service was was very friendly and helpful. The room was very basic, small, nothing fancy, but clean and comfortable enough for my needs (although I was a bit sad there was no tea/coffee set in the room). Breakfast was again - not fancy - but good and totally satisfying. I especially loved the peaceful and quiet atmosphere in the breakfast area (also watching over and including a nice little garden) perhaps to be attributed to the small size of the hotel? In any case, it was different than what I was used to from other hotels where breakfast halls were always packed and noisy. Here it was a different experience and a great way to start the day!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Jamesiam
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for us. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and larger than many European hotel rooms. There was no A/C and we were there during some unusually hot weather, but we lost no sleep because of it. The neighborhood was quiet even though we were there during the World Cup. Our room was also quiet. The breakfast was excellent and met all our needs. I highly recommend the Owl.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & bathrooms.Otherwise: Crummy hotel, tatty bedlinens, clueless management, too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: ACalGal
Reviews.Content: If the Owl took care of its rooms by - recarpeting - replacing the torn curtains - replacing the nasty, tatty, threadbare bed linens - actually hiring cleaners who knew how to truly clean - repairing broken amenities like lights and in-room safes instead of denying that they are broken or saying that guests simply aren't using them correctly - and investing in new, non-saggy mattresses; AND if the Owl's front desk staff provided smart, insightful tips to guests instead of terrible, misinformed and downright bad suggestions THEN this might be an OK place to stay. If you do stay here, be sure to book into a large room overlooking the garden. Many rooms here are incredibly small, And, the rooms in the front of the building are plagued with terrible street noise from rude passersby and early-morning street cleaners. Our room was dirty! The bathrooms, however, are nicer and more recently remodeled than those at other three-stars in the neighborhood. And we liked that this was a non-smoking hotel. Also, be sure to get your suggestions for where to eat, where to go and how to get there from someone OTHER than the daytime front desk staff at the Owl. However, the night staff at the Owl was quite helpful and smart by comparison. Part of the problem is that three-star hotels in Amsterdam simply are not of a very good quality when compared with three-star hotels at comparable prices in other European cities. Bottom line: The price at the Owl is about 30 or 40 Euros per night too high for what is delivered. We hated The Owl and will never stay here again. We will, however, stay in this exact same neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great little find”
Reviews.Author: slider143
Reviews.Content: My Aunt recommended this hotel to me last summer and I am now a repeat offender. Close to museum square and great resturants, this hotel is tucked away in a quiet area. While there is no air conditioning in this hotel ask for a room in the back and they are quite cool. The rooms are small but cozy.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: stargirl423
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mom for 5 nights. We had a great experience. The hotel was in a quiet area and was just a short walk to the Vondelpark, Van Gogh museum, and Leidseplein. The room was on the top floor and was very hot, but leaving the window open and a fan running made it tolerable. The room was pretty small and the bathroom tiny, but we didn't spend much time in the room. The back garden was enjoyable to sit in, and the staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAC1030
Reviews.Content: We stayed four days at the OWL Hotel and can definenately recommend this hotel to others. We were three friends together and the room for three, although not huge, was big enough. The bathroom was OK. The shower was not big but the water was warm. Breakfast is OK but it would be nice to have fresh fruit but it is definately good enough to start the day with. There is a nice courtyard to use when the weather is good. The location is perfect. One a quiet side street but very close to public transport, direct bus to airport (nr. 197) and the Leisdesplein which is full of resturants and entertainment. The hotel is within walking distance to most all of the major tourist attractions but 5 minutes away from the tram nr. 2 and 5 which go into the central train station. The hotel employees were friendly and very helpful. The desk is manned 24 hours a day and the front door is locked "after hours" (ring the bell to get in) which is very comforting. The huge Vollendam park is a 5 minute walk from the Owl and it is a wonderful green oasis in the city. We will definately stay here again if we go to amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Owl Hotel-Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: blakkkobera
Reviews.Content: A 20 min bus ride (4 Euro each) on the 197 bus from Schipol, and a 5 minute walk from Leidseplein got us to the hotel. Check-in was super-fast, but we were apprehensive when we saw the small room that had a musty smell.--opening the windows cleared the mustiness, and once we accepted the small European size room, we began to enjoy the experience. The location of the hotel is unbeatable--5 minutes walk from Leidseplein, with its many bars and restaurants, and the same distance from Vondelpark. 10 minutes walk to Rijks and Van Gogh Museums, the Concertgebouw and the canal cruise, and a 15-20 min walk to Anne Franks' House. Super connectivity to Centraal Station via the no 1, 2, and 5 trams and a 15-20 minute ride. Since pretty much all trams converge at Centraal, that makes it a convenient place from where to get to any part of the city.A nice Jazz bar called Alto close by (in the lane which has Burger King on the corner of Leidseplein). The staff is super efficient and extremely helpful--we asked for extra pillows and sheets, and got them very quickly. My wife sprained her ankle on our visit to Anne Franks' House, and when we asked the hotel reception for a doctor, they arranged the appointment, the taxi, and had us in the doctor's clinic in 20 minutes flat. The reception is manned around the clock, to a large extent by what seem to be family members, who's frendliness and warmth make you feel as if you are living in a Dutch family home rather than a hotel. The entire hotel exudes the easy grace and charm that typifies Amsterdam as a city. Breakfast is the only meal available in the hotel--there are cereals with milk or yoghurt, a fruit mix, boiled eggs, tea, coffee, juice, cake, and three types of breads, cheese and cold cuts, making it an adequate, if not extensive, breakfast. The food was always fresh, and the rooms were cleaned daily, and very thoroughly. The entire hotel is extremely clean and well maintained. There is a safe and hair dryer in the room. The stairs are very narrow, and the lift is good enough for three people, or two if there is luggage. Internet in the room is paid for, though there is free shared internet behind the breakfast room (with lots of Owl figurines to keep you company). There is a small sitting area/bar next to the breakfast room, and another small outdoors sitting/smoking area beside it. The resident cat sometimes can be found here, and seems popular with the guests. A couple of irritants I faced were the light switch built into the bed's headboard which kept switching the bedroom light off and on every time I shifted position while watching TV in bed, and a switch hidden in the top of the bathroom shaving light which took me quite a while figure out. But these were minor irritants in an otherwise very comfortable and enjoyable stay. Thank you all you wonderful people at Owl--we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Athena813
Reviews.Content: Owl hotel staff was conveniently located in the Leidesplein area which has lot of restaurants and tram stops. Both Heineken brewery, canal cruise departure point and the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum are within walking distance. The tram stop to go the Dam square is near too. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I am not Dutch but they spoke excellent English and gave us good advice on how to plan the sightseeing around Amsterdam. The rooms and bathrooms were clean. The hotel breakfast was very simple but still ok considering the room price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls with lots of noise”
Reviews.Author: DaveHMaryland
Reviews.Content: There's no question that the location is great and the price reasonable. The Owl is only 3 blocks from the Leidseplein and the tram lines that take you around much of the city. The staff was friendly, but not very sure of area restaurants, most of which are bars and crowded with college aged groups. The bathroom is adequate, but missing some items like facial tissue and their liquid soap dispenser with only one variety is expected to be used for hand, bath and shampoo. The worst problem is the thin walls separating the rooms. We had a court facing room, so street noise was not an issue, but routine noises from neighboring rooms on the sides and above were very annoying. Breakfast was less than expected. They did offer juice, coffeee, hard boiled eggs and 3 varieties of ham and cheese, but the bread was strictly slices of white and wheat that went into the toaster. There was a raisin bread soft roll and some dried cereal for others. When compared with friends staying in a comparable hotel, the Owl came in second place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Hawkeye3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Owl from 4/7/10 through 4/10; then again for 8 more days beginning 4/16. The later stay was the result of our flight being canceled, courtesy of the volcano. The Owl is an excellent choice for a mid-range Hotel in Europe. It is well located, well maintained and clean. The desk staff are terrific. They have a good continental breakfast in nice surroundings. There are a number of good restaurants within walking distance. It is on a quiet street. (Note: when we took a cab from the airport, I said "The Owl Hotel, please." He had no idea what I was talking about. I then showed him a confirmation sheet with the name and address. He said 'Oh, the O-val', and off we went).

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected stay in nice place”
Reviews.Author: MagusRU
Reviews.Content: I originally booked this hotel for overnight stay for my wife after her business trip to Amsterdam. The choice was made based on the comments from respectful Tripadvisor members. For different reasons we had to cancel. BUT the volcano changed the plans dramatically. My wife stuck in the city and I tried to help her from overseas to arrange her stay. I called the hotel and booked the room for her (seems to be the last one). When my wife came to the hotel in hour later she immediately got the room and nobody even took her credit card to guarantee. Finally she spent four nights at the hotel. Following are the comments that she made after her stay: The location is very quiet, far from any busy streets and close to the park. It is located in 5 min walking distance from Leidseplein. When you wake up in the morning you can hear the birds singing. The hotel itself is very clean but basic. During stay the majority of guests were older generation. All the reception staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was included in the room but was very basic and similar during all stay. She believed that some variations may be advised. There is free Internet access in the lobby (one computer) â€“ actually there was a line to this computer as everybody was checking their cancelled/delayed flights ))). Also please note that there is a stop for the airport bus (on the way between Leidseplein and the hotel). It takes 20 minutes to get to airport and cost only 3EUR. That was kindly advised on the reception. The stay was really enjoyable and comfortable. The next visit to Amsterdam that will be our choice for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, fair price, great location”
Reviews.Author: BearsinArlington
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the Owl. The desk staff were very helpful in directions, plaxces to go, what was open and not, The room for my wife, me and my daughter (7 years old) had 2 twin beds pushed together, and two beds that folded out of the wall. The light was good and the bathrrom clean. Breakfast was basic, but fine. The location was great. Close to museums, canal rides, restaurants, grocery stores,trams, shopping, parks. Overall a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Oasis During the Ash Cloud Crisis”
Reviews.Author: Gibsongrrl
Reviews.Content: I was originally booked at the Owl Hotel for three nights; the volcano ash cloud added three nights to my stay in Amsterdam, and I couldn't have asked for a more comfortable place to be delayed. To a person, staff was helpful, pleasant and accommodating in every sense of the word. This is a clean, quiet, comfortable hotel, close to transit and attractions - especially the museums. I would highly recommend the Owl Hotel to anyone seeking quality accommodations in Amsterdam. A family atmosphere prevails at this lovely little gem. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic and clean”
Reviews.Author: barbie1977
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location and yet away from noise. It is a small, basic hotel and we have stayed in it several times and can not find fault with anything.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our choice”
Reviews.Author: micdev
Reviews.Content: In a great location just off the Leidseplein,this is a great hotel for a sightseeing stay in Amsterdam.The very friendly & helpful reception staff are the first plus.The room was another.Clean,bright & big enough with comfortable furniture,i had no problems with noise even though my room was located at the front of the hotel,directly over the street.Tv was located out of harms way,high on the wall at the foot of the bed.No minibar or coffee/tea making facilities though & the room temperature was a little bit on the cool side.Bathroom was a decent size with a great pressure shower,hairdryer etc but there could have been another towel or two.Breakfast was good with plenty of choice & the reception area was a great place to chill with comfortable sofas looking out into the hotel garden & the small hotel bar located adjacent.The buzzer controlled front doors added a sense of safety & security to the hotel. Location wise the hotel was in a perfect place.Less than 5 minutes walk to Leidseplein,about 10 minutes to Jordaan,a little over 15 minutes to Ann Frank Huis & 20+ minutes to Dam square & Madame Tussauds.Vondelpark was about 5 minutes walk,Rijksmuseum less than 10 minutes & the Heineken brewery about 15 minutes walk away.On the only occasion that we didn't walk,we used the watertaxi from Leidseplein to Centraal station,a great relaxed way to see the city. Close by bars included the excellent Bourbon Street Blues Club,The Hard Rock Cafe & Irish pubs,The Aran,Murphy's & The Hoopman,none of which were anything special but all of them were in good locations to use as meeting points.Just off the Leidseplein,we tried the Sette Bello Italian pizza restaurant on one night.After waiting for more than 45 minutes for our pizzas to arrive,atleast they tasted fairly good but the one memory that i take from the place was the absolute stench from the upstairs toilets.If you do find yourself in that restaurant,use somewhere else's toilets,they really were that foul. & will we be back to the Owl Hotel? We've already booked for next march.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Peak District National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: MissTigerFish
Reviews.Content: Great, hotel, great location, great staff. The room was perfect, large and clean. Breakfast was plentiful. The staff were very friendly and helpful in directing us, and also arranging taxi's etc. The location is great near plenty of bars and restaurants, and also walking distance to all major attractions. Recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “How nice to stay in such a happy & family friendly independent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DarkGlobe
Reviews.Content: I spent a total of 9 nights over two separate trips in the Owl hotel in Feb and I'm sure I will be back again one day. The hotel is located exactly 5 minutes walk from Leidseplein and is a bit tricky to find as it's tucked away behind the Marriott. Leidseplein is a convenient place to be as it has constant trams to the centre running through it and plenty of restaurants & shops. In the other direction, the Owl hotel is less than 10 minutes walk from the Van Gogh museum. Being neatly tucked away makes the Owl very quiet, it's also very clean, nicely decorated, it has wireless internet that actually works, it has happy & friendly staff and it has the 'stairs of doom' as we named them...but it also has a lift so you don't have to brave them. The room I stayed in was adequately sized, clean and comfortable with a lovely bathroom you could actually move about in and a pleasant view out of the window. The Owl Hotel does not provide tea & coffee making facilities in the rooms though which did rather upset my colleague. As I drink neither, I hadn't actually noticed. Included breakfasts are very good continental style breakfasts and they're served between 7:30 & 10:30 which is handy for people slow to leave their bed in the mornings. Really though, the staff are the hotel's greatest asset with their cheery hellos when you arrive and friendly goodbyes when you leave. I spent a couple of evenings at the bar chatting to the staff & other guests that stopped by. Here's a little example of quality customer service... On my second visit to the Owl, I brought my family with me. My daughter is still small so she sleeps in a travel cot usually in our room when we go away. Fortunately the Owl have these cots so we didn't have to bring our own but here's the thing: When we opened the door to our room for the first time, the cot was already in there, setup. That might not seem like a big deal, but it is indicative of the staff's attention to detail at the Owl. When we toured round part of the US back in 2008, not one of the half dozen hotels we stayed in had the cot ready for us despite us making sure they had these cots and specifying very clearly we were bringing a baby. Always we had to phone reception and remind them to bring one up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Ramblingman99
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with this little hotel. Great location, very friendly/helpful staff, nice continental breakfast, very clean. Small, but for the price, fantastic value. I would stay again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Lives Up To The Hype”
Reviews.Author: janey6
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights with my partner. Chose the hotel due to previous TA reviews. Was not disappointed. The hotel is pretty basic but for the price it offers good value and a short walk to the museums and Leidseplein from where it is then a 10 minute walk to most places of interest in the City. Breakfast is fine if you don't want a fry up ( being a veggie no problem). Toast, cheese, cold meats, cereal, fruit, yoghurt etc. Coffee is excellent. No negatives to report. Will stay there again on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Business & Leisure”
Reviews.Author: jrasberry
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what you want when visiting Amsterdam. It sits in the heart of the city and is within walking distance of many of the city's great attractions. The accomodations are nice and the staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly priced and nice location”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter1979
Reviews.Content: I had a generally nice stay at the Owl Hotel. My friends and I had a hard time finding it though - it's not quite located exactly as their online map shows. The hotel itself was cozy and comfortable, and the hotel staff was very helpful. They have free internet access but no printer attached to the computer, so when I completed online check-in for my return flight, I emailed it to them and they kindly printed it out for me. Breakfast was a buffet with toast and marmalade, deli meats, eggs, cereal and juice. I was a little disappointed in the lack of hot breakfast, but it was alright. The location was very good I thought - it wasn't right in the historic center but it's only a short walk away, and it IS just a few minutes walk to the Van Gogh museum and the National Museum. The first room I was given I did not like - even with the heat on it just would not heat up, and the room was not in a corridor like the others but in a stairwell. Based on the temperature of the room (FYI, it was something like -15 outside, there was a blizzard all weekend, it really was freezing) I managed to have my room switched. The second room was much warmer thank goodness, and both rooms were quite nice and modern. The only 'complaint' I have is that they suggested I take the bus to the airport instead of taxi because it would be cheaper, but they didn't tell me that no buses would be running because of the blizzard! I waited in the snow for 45 minutes before walking into another hotel and ordering a taxi (much cheaper than hailing one on the street) - I almost missed my flight. I suppose it's not really their fault, but the second hotel I walked into to order my taxi said that all the locals should have known about that, including them. Oh well... All things considered I'm generally satisfied. Would I stay here again? I probably would, but I would probably have another look around and see what else I found first.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel -- convenient, quiet, and a terrific breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: sajara
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrific, so much so that we have begun a tradition of staying here and only here on our annual trek to Amsterdam. The rooms are small as per the European tradition. The place was clean, the staff was friendly, and the included breakfast was killer. The location is just a tad off the beaten path while remaining super convenient. Will stay again and again. Reading the reviews of the "5 star" hotels in Amsterdam, I'm not convinced they have much over The Owl, as long as you're not going to the city to watch television.

Reviews.Title: “Met All Expectations”
Reviews.Author: sidneyxx
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at The Owl Hotel,Amsterdam, in late September. We picked it solely from reviews on Trip Advisor and it certainly met all expectations, as far as location, cleanliness, helpfulness and friendliness of staff, good breakfast, etc. It was always a nice little haven to return to each evening. The outside courtyard was also a bonus - especially when the weather was so good whilst we were there. Re location, we found we could walk everywhere but if you wanted to get a tram they were close by. It's also only about 10 minute walk to the Concertbrouw where the most wonderful concerts seem to be held daily - sometimes afternoons and evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel good location but a bit too noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: MrFairGo
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a very location with freindly and helpful staff. Front family room suffered from a lot of noise from the street at night and early in morning though

Reviews.Title: “Ms.”
Reviews.Author: terraterraterra
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in quiet location. Very close to tram, canal boat, restaurants at Leidesplein, Vondelpark, and easy walking to the Rijksmuseum and Van Gough museum. Liked the garden in the back, the hotel cat, and the free internet access at the shared computer. (Wireless in your room is available for a charge.) Breakfast was okay: a little heavy on fat and sugar. I would have preferred some healthier choices such as muesli and real fresh fruit, not canned fruit cocktail. Staff was friendly and helpful and the room, although small, was clean and functional.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fab city”
Reviews.Author: jojo1811
Reviews.Content: Me and my mum have just returned from a short break at The Owl, staying Monday to Wednesday. We arrived early due to a night time flight, the man on reception was very friendly and checked if our room was ready for us. Although it wasnt he let us leave our luggage there and gave us directions and a map so we could explore. The location of the hotel is fab, close to the park, shops and restaurants, with easy access to the canal cruise and trams. In one direction you have the hard rock cafe and the Van Gogh museum and in the other is Anne Frank house and central station. The bedrooms in the hotel are very nice and well equiped, although slightly on the small side. Breakfast here was lovely, there is a nice dinning area and pretty outside courtyard. The food was well presented and everything you need as well as soft boiled eggs for egg and soldiers yum! We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to The Owl and would certainly return here again, not only for the extremely helpful and friendly staff, but also for the location and the comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “quite little place in great location of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: runtoeat
Reviews.Content: Booked this based on Trip advisor reviews, and glad we did. Amsterdam is a loud place that keeps late hours so I wanted a place to retreat.
