Owl hotel has first class typical European rooms, but they are tucked away on a side street and location is very quite and very accessable. Breakfast is very Dutch (which we like), rooms were clean and since it was summer we slept with windows open and the room was equipped with a fan which we loved because it covered what little noise we had. The place is a Gem and I would recommend it t anyone. Staff was also very nice and always happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy place!”
Reviews.Author: gqRob
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Owl. The staff were friendly. The rooms were very clean and cosy. Location was close to everything yet quiet. Great bang for the buck too! Rob

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, fab hotel staff, fab location!!”
Reviews.Author: mitch76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in May/June. I cannot fault this hotel at all, the staff were super efficient and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The location was perfect, close enough to everything but far enough away to get a good quiet nights sleep. Amsterdam was beautiful and we walked almost everywhere. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the breakfast was lovely and set you up for a full day of sight seeing. If you want a great place to stay and dont like staying in large hotel chains then this is the place for you, this is more of a boutique hotel. You are always greeted with a smile, and the owners make you feel very welcome. If I am lucky enough to visit Amsterdam again I will definitely being staying at the Owl Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: scottie0077
Reviews.Content: I visited The Owl Hotel with my parents this Spring and have to say I was very impressed with the warm welcome by the owners and the superb cleanliness of the hotel. It has a lift - a rare find in small hotels in Amsterdam. Only downside is that there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. The hotel is in a peaceful area of Amsterdam near the museums and just a short walk to the tram stops. It is a good 10 min walk to a good and reasonable restaurant so don't stay here if you want to be in the thick of the action. It was perfect for us though and access to the trams was necessary for my parents who can't be on their feet walking all day. Both myself and my parents would definately stay again and I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all glamourus but quite nice and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: TravelerOfSorts
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to the center of town. They have a nice garden in the back and a fairly good breakfast that is included (at least when we were there). The room and our private bathroom were clean. Not much noise from the street. Overall it was well worth the money and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: World_Is_Ours1
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 8 year old son and I stayed here from April 28-May 5. This little hotel was close to everything we wanted to see & the staff was wonderful, warm and inviting. We especially loved Disney, the kitty that lives to charm the guests. The garden was a wonderful place to relax and recharge after an active day on the town. Smoking (of all sorts) was welcome ONLY in this area. The common area was clean, well kept & in order. Breakfast was more expansive than you'd generally expect in Europe and the rooms were well appointed. Vondelpark was a hop, skip and a jump away. The neighborhood was quiet, even on Queen's Day, and located just blocks away from the action. It was truly an oasis in the middle of a very chaotic party scene! I couldn't find one single thing to complain about and I'm certain that we'll visit the Owl again the next time we vacation in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChillyMillie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the quad room for three nights and found the Owl to be the perfect place to stay. The hotel was well-located and we walked everywhere from the Owl. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable, it was quiet and easy to rest during the night. We found the staff very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was plentiful and delicious. The patio/lounge was a perfect place for a cocktail after a day of sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: holsmania
Reviews.Content: stayed a few nights i march 09. nice friendly hotel. marina on reception was very nice and helpful. rooms were spacious. breakfast was nice. hotel is in quiet street in leidseplein. no complaints at all, would stay here again no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the Owl”
Reviews.Author: nursedude
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for six nights at the Owl over the Christmas holidays and we enjoyed it very much. Very nice room at the back of the hotel, great staff, friendly and informative, nice being in a quiet Amsterdam neighborhood so close to everything. A modest breakfast buffet, but they do have Corn Flakes, in addition to meats and cheeses and fresh bread for the toaster. The Owl took care of us very nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel but bring your ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: WendySouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: We felt very welcome and comfortable right from the beginning. All reception staff were great and more than ready to answer any questions we might have had. Room was comfortable, quite spacious, well appointed and very clean. Breakfast, although continental was also quite good, particularly coffee which was excellent. Breakfast available until 10.30 which was also nice. Good location, near to trams and nice restaurant area. Lovely park nearby too. Shuttle from airport worked well. However on the minus side lighting in room at night was dim and bedside lights were a strain to read by, which we like to do. The bedroom walls are also paper thin and so you are disturbed by other room sounds. Anyone running a bath/shower or using a hair dryer could be doing so in your own room. Also all doors seem to have to slam to close. So unless you are a really early riser or a really heavy sleeper, the noise factor will be quite a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel with great service and value”
Reviews.Author: jcraddock4
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this wonderful hotel and highly recommend it for travelers looking for an above average place to stay at that is a great value. Breakfast was large with many options for travelers from all over the world. Location is excellent, just a couple blocks from Leidseplein Square, which is where the Marriott Hotel is located. It is about a 5 minute walk to the Van Gogh Museum, and about a 15 minute walk to the Anne Frank Museum and Rijksmuseum. As a travel agency owner who travels all over the world - I know what hotels typically offer based on class of service. I highly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to send clients who are looking for a charming property with loads of ambience, good friendly service and good location. Joyce Craddock of Incredible Journey Travel in California

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel i the heart of town”
Reviews.Author: yesuthasen
Reviews.Content: My wife collects owls and when we planned a three day trip to Amsterdam, it was natural that the Owl Hotel caught our eye. While that was interesting enough, it was the reviews on TripAdvisor that decided for us. We were not disappointed. It is in an excellent location, on a quiet street in the center of town, hardly a ten to fifteen minute stroll from the major museums and the entertainment and eating places of the Leidseplein. You can get there easily by tram from the Central Station, if you don't mind a ten minute walk with your baggage. For about fifteen euros a taxi will drop you of at the door. The complimentary breakfast, is a small but nice spread, served in a room overlooking a little garden, where it would be great to sit when the weather allows us to. Its a small hotel but neat and clean with all the basic facilities.The staff were very friendly and helpful. The safe in the room is at ground level inside the wardrobe. Lying flat on my stomach I couldn't read the instructions. Fortunately, they have a lockers at reception where you can keep your stuff. While you cant make coffee or tea in the room, the drinks at the bar are reasonably priced. If you carried a lap top, wifi costs three euros for an hour, (compared to six euros for half an hour at the place we stayed at Antwerp). If you use the hotel's computer, internet is complimentary. We really enjoyed our stay at the Owl Hotel and while leaving my wife was happy to give them an owl to add to their small collection !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrific value, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Rhodes461
Reviews.Content: The Owl is a super little hotel with great staff in a terrific location just 3 minutes walk from the Leidesplein. Very close to the major art museums and a canal bus stop. The room was tiny, but I've heard that's the case with most rooms in Amsterdam. They could use better pillows I'll say, but for the money it was a fantastic 4 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellend location”
Reviews.Author: mp2783
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend at the Owl hotel .This hotel is lovely. Very clean, tidy and quiet. It is just 1 minute walk from Leidsplein in a quiet street (behind the Marriot hotel) and 2 minute walk from the museums. Very convenient for sightseeing in Amsterdam. I have visited Amsterdam for 1 night with my brother and we chose this hotel through the trip advisor reviews. The carpets are brand new, and the room is of good size. We paid 130 Euros for 1 night for a room including breakfast which we thought was of excellent value. We were not expecting much for breakfast but is a lovely continental spread with cheeses and different breads. Overall I would say this is probably a good option for sightseeing in Amsterdam and an absolute must . I am recommending this hotel for a basic stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: WendyandPaul
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Amsterdam and stayed at the Owl Hotel. The hotel is off the main road and takes a minute or so to walk to Leidseplein and a little longer to the museum quarter (Van Gough etc) The staff at the hotel were really helpful and polite; there were 14 of us and we arrived early but were allowed to go into our rooms (except one) as they were ready. Breakfast was really nice with a small selection of cereals, Meat, yoghurt and bread. Tea/Coffee machine. There are no tea and coffee facilities in the rooms but that didn't bother us. The rooms varied in size ours being slightly smaller than others and were all exceptionally clean, all rooms had a safe. The hotel had a lovely secluded garden with tables and chairs. The hotel bar was really cheap - bonus! If I return to Amsterdam I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dizzy060
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Owl for four nights with my husband to celebrate our Ruby Wedding. The hotel is in a good position, very clean and the breakfast is OK. Its very easy to get a bus or tram just over the road. On arriving at the airport we got tickets to Centraal Station then the number 5 tram and got off at the Van Gough Museum. We got lost for a while, your landmark is the Marriot Hotel, the Owl Hotel is in a side road by the Marriot. Going back to the airport we got the 197 bus wich runs every 15 minutes. the stop is over the road from the hotel. Amsterdam can be very busy, this hotel was very peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: claretandbluerich
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel set in a quiet side street just a few minutes walk from the Leidesplein or Vondelpark. You can also get either a 1,2 or 5 line tram to or from Centraal station or to Dam Square very easily. The staff were very welcoming and were always happy to help or advise about Amsterdam. I stayed in a double room with my girlfriend which was a decent size and ensuite. The breakfast was good and the hotel has a nice lounge area. There is a free Internet connection if you just have to find out how your football team did at the start of the season (they won)! If you are looking for this star rating/price of hotel then I thoroughly recommend the Owl Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “tiny and clean”
Reviews.Author: xoTR
Reviews.Content: i stayed in room 48. It was small but clean. Had no problem at all. Front desk was very helpful. Breakfast was nice too. My room was silent. I will stay there again. At night after 00:00 you must knock the door to get in :))) Non smoking hotel by the way

Reviews.Title: “tiny with charm”
Reviews.Author: getmeoutofangola
Reviews.Content: Made the mistake of booking a single room. Should have gone for bigger. Room felt like a closet. Really really tiny. Shower was extremely small too though I am a woman of average size. On the plus side, lovely staff and outside patio. Nice breakfast. Free Internet a plus. Nicely located near museums, parks, and tram access nearby. Would probably stay at the Merriott next door next time, will lose the charm but gain in space.

Reviews.Title: “Owl a Lovely Experience”
Reviews.Author: cruisequeengoddess
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam early Monday morning after completing a wonderful 14 day transatlantic crossing and were greeted with sunny skies and temperatures in the high 70s as well as it being a national holiday. Amsterdam was buzzing with activity. We arrived at the hotel around 9 am and well ahead of check in time, but the hotel personnel were so gracious and kind and stored our luggage for us while we went exploring until our rooms were ready. The rooms were spacious and comfortable, although there was no air conditioning. The bathrooms were very nice. Things got a bit warm but kept busy during the day and tried to only be in our rooms at night when it had cooled down. We could open the windows and get a lovely cool breeze. The breakfast was quite lovely and ample, and sitting out on the cool and pretty terrace was very pleasant. All of the staff, and especially Marina, were very helpful at all times, arranging for a large van pick us up when we checked out on Thursday, helping us get dinner reservations, and in general making our stay quite comfortable. The hotel is very conveniently located to everything and in a very very quiet neighborhood - as opposed to the very dirty and noisy central area of Amsterdam. We are very glad we picked this location and this hotel. Price-wise it was very reasonable and I would not hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid”
Reviews.Author: bozbird
Reviews.Content: Arrived from Paris about mid day, had little trouble finding 'The Owl' from Centraal. Check in was a breeze. Room was clean and manuverable(sp). Fairly nice view out the window. Elevator quite small, Folding cage door will bite you if not paying attention. Hotel near the splien and many decent restaurants. Transpo is pretty tricky though. Had afternoon drinks at the Owl. Very liberal. Breakfast next morning, very tasty. Management went out of way to take care of our laundry. The Owl was more than what we expected :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Batsby
Reviews.Content: This is a good deal for Amsterdam where rooms are notoriously small. Rooms here are spacious and not over-priced. Trams 1,2 and 5 from the main train station 'Amsterdam Centraal' all pass within 200 metres of the hotel. Alight at Leidesplein as other reviewers mention. There is free internet in the lobby and a decent breakfast each morning. One tip is don't stay in room 27. It's above the internet room door which also leads to the stairs guests on the first floor often use to get to their rooms instead of using the lift. I heard this door a lot at night so moved to room 37 and all ok. Reception staff excellent. I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Price”
Reviews.Author: RetiredAD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Owl Hotel for two nights in mid April while waiting to board a river boat. The hotel was an exceptional deal in a great location. We arrived around 11 AM and our room was ready. Recommend room #26. Bright, airy and overlooks the garden. The included breakfasts were typically European with cereal, juice, cold cuts, pastry, toast, hb eggs, and great coffee. The hotel also had a small bar for a late afternoon beer or a night cap. Plenty of restaurants around for meals, and a short walk to Leidesplain. If we get to Amsterdam again and need a hotel, we will definitely stay at the Owl.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for ALL travellers”
Reviews.Author: GirlsTrips2008
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam AT ANOTHER HOTEL to find out that our hotel room had been double booked.... we visited the tourist information centre and they booked us a room at The Owl.... What a lovely hotel! Brilliant location, very near to ledseiplen square and Vondel Park. Staff were very friendly, breakfast was great, room was perfect....and the hotel was cheap!!!!! I reccomend this hotel for pretty much everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Owl!”
Reviews.Author: jester7107
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful little hotel! My husband and I were very impressed with the staff. Everyone was very helpful with directions and suggestions. Breakfast was simple; toast, eggs, coffee, tea, milk and cereal but it was included in the price of the room. The dining room looks out over the back garden. The bar is really just an extension of the front desk but there are a couple nice couches and chairs to relax in. Our room was very clean and had plenty of room to unpack our things for a long weekend. The double bed was on the small side and it would have been nice to have more than one pillow each. The cable tv had muliple English language channels. The walls are a little thin...we could hear our neighbors arguing at 2 a.m. The hotel is located near a tram stop but is within walking distance of just about anything for two young adults. If you have children it would be quite a hike to the Anne Frank House or to the Royal Palace. There are plenty of good restaurants nearby including a fabulous little Italian place called La Cucina De Cesare that is about 4 blocks from the hotel. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: vulevu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location close to many of the attractions but in a quite location in a side street. We are a family of 5 and had one double room and one triple room. The rooms are all recently refurbished and extremely clean. The bathrooms are quite small but newly refurbished and clean. Breakfast is downstairs with a good selection of cerials, meats, cheeses, bread and fruit. It is enough selection for a hearty start to the day. We were delayed one day due to being fogged in at London Heathrow and the staff did not not charge us for the first nights accomodation which they were entitled to. At all times the staff were freindly and helpfull. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great littel hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennnee
Reviews.Content: Owl Hotel was a great find! The location is fabulous - tucked away in a quiet littel street yet within 5 mins walk to Leidseplein. We had the quad room which was the biggest room in the hotel according to the front desk, so there were no space issues fort us. We had a king size bed, 2 single beds (double-decker), an LCD TV and a tiny coffee table with some chairs, and the room was still spacious. The rooms were always clean. Didn't notice any smoke smell (unlike Holiday Inn Heathrow). The dining and lounge setup was really cosy and they had a beautiful Christmas tree- so eveything felt really homey and cosy. Unfortunately for us the weather was much too cold for us to sit outside in the patio - it must be quite lovely in summer! Breakfast was more than substantial - 3 kinds of cold cuts, 3 kinds of bread, 2 kinds of cheeses, boiled eggs, biscuits, a variety of cereals, fresh milk and cream, coffee, tea, hot choch, orange juice. Absolutely spoilt for choice! Don't miss their little collection of owl figurines by the computer - they provide free internet access so another plus point! Don't hesitate in booking Owl Hotel for your stay in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but small rooms too depressing”
Reviews.Author: Peacecow
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Owl four different times and it is a fine small hotel really. Like most stays, however, the overall quality depends on the room. The first two times I had a courtyard room with a full bed, the last two were tiny rooms with a single bed by the wall, a stucco wall at that, one that will scrape your arm at night. There was no room at all and as for the tiny bathroom, you could not do #2 without ducking under the sink (sorry, but that's the truth). Lord willing, I am going back to Amsterdam this January and at first was in auto-pilot mode to go back to the Owl. I emailed them requesting a room, but did not hear back. So I kept checking other options and decided upon another hotel, who assured me I would get a nice room with a double bed overlooking the courtyard. The Owl does have a nice breakfast and complimentary internet and computer usage. Just ask for a bigger room unless you are sure you are okay with a tiny room with a single bed by the wall. Oh, and it is in a great location near the Vondel park and the museums.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: quinnkk
Reviews.Content: The family-run Owl is an old favourite of ours and it did not disappoint. We stayed for 4 nights (third year in a row) in a large family room. Twin beds for adults and bunk beds for children. The staff are always friendly and helpful. Small lounge/bar and breakfast areas are very good. Buffet breakfast is always well-stocked and frequently replenished. Could do with a bit more variety (fresh fruit and yoghurts perhaps) but was good enough for the price. The room was fine. Bathroom a bit small and my sense of smell detected that a smoker had been in the room recently. However, this is the Netherlands and in smaller hotels exclusive non-smoking rooms have not necessarily caught on. Furnishings are ok but perhaps getting a bit dated. The hotel is in a quiet side street (there are a number of hotels in this road - more spring up each year) and it is a matter of a few minutes walk from the Leidseplein, park and museums. The tram for the station is also very close. For my young family it is far away from the bawdy side of life that tends to blight certain areas of the lovely city, especially near the station and with the proximity of the restaurants and facilties at Leideseplein the location takes some beating. The Owl has character and is worth considering for a short family break. This is not a budget hotel but we found the facilities and location to be very good value at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem Of A Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuzieSunflower
Reviews.Content: Super little hotel, tucked away on a quiet street yet close to main attractions. Rooms comfortble, warm and cosy, great breakfast, lovely fresh boiled eggs, very good choice of meats, cheese and bread. Cosy little lounge where you can have tea, coffee or a beer overlooking the garden, will definatley return here if we visit Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: tlightb
Reviews.Content: The Owl Hotel is in an excellent location in Amsterdam. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the rooms are very clean and well serviced. The buffet breakfast is very good. The double rooms are small and there is not a lot of storage space. If you are used to a large bed you will find this a problem here. There is no airconditioning and this could be a problem in the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “owl hotel just great!!”
Reviews.Author: marba
Reviews.Content: went to amsterdam in june for the first time and made a point of using trip advisor to judge the hotels i'd picked out. out of the few hotels i had shortlisted the owl hotel stood out as having only good things said about it. every review was spot on!! great location great price really nice little hotel!! well done to all the reviewers i was able to make a really good choice using this website once again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shazhudson
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Owl from 24.06.07 to 30.06.07. This was my eighth visit to Amsterdam and we decided to try a different hotel, we were very pleasantly surprised. The staff are all very friendly and helpful, the cleaning staff are brilliant. Our room was cleaned and made-up one morning after we came back from breakfast!! They keep the place lovely and clean, the reception, lounge and breakfast areas are very pleasant on the eye and everything is really chilled when you go for breakfast which is a great relief from the craziness of Amsterdam. The breakfast does not offer enormous variety but it is very good and everything is very fresh and tasty, it set us up perfectly for the day. They have a free internet service next to the breakfast room where you can have a quick check up of emails, etc on their PC. This is a first for me and a great little service. There were a couple of minor things that need slight repair in the room but nothing that would spoil anybody's holiday. For example, one of the sockets did not work. Yet another great visit to Amsterdam, will no doubt be back next year and I will definitely consider staying in the Owl again. Oh, and try the Toro Dorado grill restaurant on N.Z. Voorburgwal for a great meal, I've been a few times and have overlooked mentioning it before! Oriental City is a lovely Chinese too! Stay at the Owl, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SunStorm
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the Owl Hotel Amsterdam in June 2007. We picked this hotel because of it's location and favorable reviews. We were not dissappointed. The location is excellent, nearly adjoining Vondel Park and close to canals and the centre yet very quiet. This small hotel (34 rooms) is very clean, tidy and friendly. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and pleasant. The included breakfasts were an added bonus and good enough we were never tempted to go out for breakfast. The rooms were smallish as is the norm for hotels of this class in Europe but modern and spotless. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Don't look anywhere else for a hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: BOREDATHOME
Reviews.Content: There is nothing negative I can say about this hotel. Outstanding location, very very quite in the evenings, clean, large rooms, ultra helpful staff, great breakfast, all in all probalbly the best hotel my wife and I have stayed in while traveling in Europe, and trust me Im very very fussy. 128 euros per night is well worth the money for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but great location”
Reviews.Author: philcab
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Owl for 5 nights in March. It was myself, my wife, and my three small children. We had arranged for a quad with an extra cot as bed 5. The room would have been small for just my wife and I, let alone the five of us. Still it was quite clean, and efficiently cleaned every day. We arrived at around 9AM and were pleasantly surprised when our room was available. With three small kids with jet lag, this was terrific and I will always be thankful to the Owl. Breakfast needs to be expanded. The breads are simply slices from a packaged loaf, no rolls, nor croissants. There was no yogurt and the fruit salad seemed to be from a jar. It would also be nice if they kept the coffee machine on 24 hrs for self serve. There are few amenities at the hotel. No shampoo in the rooms, no coffee in the rooms, no minibar nor refrigerator, no cable TV. The location is fabulous. Can't be beat!!!!! The staff was efficient and appropriate but I wouldn't say overly friendly, But not rude nor unpleasant, either. I would stay at the Owl Again but I would probably look around to see what else is available first.

Reviews.Title: “Worth money spent”
Reviews.Author: alexgenf
Reviews.Content: Moderate pricing, good location, clean and neat. Everything that I was looking for in Amsterdam I found there.

Reviews.Title: “Fly in for a good value room”
Reviews.Author: London_BW
Reviews.Content: Stay here! Ok, youâ€™re not going to be blown away with sharp design and a funky interior, but the whole hotel is spotlessly clean, recently redecorated and has a rather unique feel to it. Plus each member of staff we met â€“ be it the guy who runs the place or the young man who worked the night shift, were beyond brilliant, knowledgeable of the city and super-helpful. The rooms are roomier than I thought theyâ€™d be. The bathrooms are spacious with a powerful shower in the bath. The breakfast is buffet style â€“ help yourself to as much cheese, slices of meat, boiled eggs, cereal, fruit, tea, coffee, waffles as you can manage. Itâ€™s centrally located to the main touristy stretch and one of the main squares. Just remember, a taxi from the airport to the Owl Hotel should be around 30 euros. Pay much more than that and youâ€™re being taken for a ride (quite literally). We paid almost 40 euro â€¦ we obviously looked like tourists! The hotel has a tiny lift. Somewhat of plus considering the tall, steep stairs that every building seems to have. Sadly we only had one night in the city but will return and will stay there. For the price, it's faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Owl Hotel a winner”
Reviews.Author: travelfar
Reviews.Content: Celebrated New Years in Amsteram and the OWL hotel made it even better experience! Very courteous staff, clean with comfy and cozy living room area nice small bar and the prices were fantastic (both bar and rooms!) Very very convenient to museums, casino, shopping and rest. around Leidesplein....just 1 1/2 block away from tram. Left small bag of luggage there and they are shipping it to me in US! very helpful and cant wait to stay there again in the springtime!

Reviews.Title: “a small hotel with excelent staff”
Reviews.Author: rider2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week several years ago, and I still remember it fondly. We stayed for 1 night in the Marriott nearby, and then moved to the Owl. We were living in Germany at that time and had driven our car to Amsterdam - not the best idea in hindsight . The Marriott parking garage was full the night we stayed there and they had said they could not help us, even though leaving a car unattended on the street in that area was an invitation to having it broken into. The next day the folks at the Owl impressed us by recommending a good parking garage for very little $$, calling the garage, and making sure our car got there. The rooms were small to really small, but the staff more than made up for that by being so nice to us the whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Starflight
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the OWL hotel over a week beginning Oct. 17. When we arrived just after 8 in the morning, we were told our room would be ready in 30 minutes and we were invited to sit in a lovely sitting room with television and view of the patio. We were offered and accepted tea. Check in was quick and we were shown to our room. It was nice and clean. There was cable television. The bathroom was adequate and clean. We just were not accustomed to using a "hand" shower head, but adjusted. We enjoyed having free breakfast each morning. It was delicious and served in a wonderfully warm setting with clean linen and china. The staff of the hotel was accommodating, extremely polite and smiling no matter what time of day or night. The Owl is in the midst of the great museums. It is just a short walk to the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum. It is also a very short walk to Leidsplein and public transportation (the Trams). Restaurant row is only blocks away as well. The hotel also has a computer for those who wish to check emails.The hotel made our trip to Amsterdam fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel in a good position”
Reviews.Author: RachSB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fabulous position for exploring, but without being too close to the loud and busy square and bars in this area - a 5-10 minute walk gets you to hundreds of restaurants and bars. The reception was very nice and friendly - and our room was ok. It was small and a disappointment to start with - but we soon got used to it.....at least the small bathroom was clean. The decor was tired and we discovered a plastic bottle under our bed which was not a great indication of cleanliness....especially at the price of the rooms. That said, we would consider going there again if we went back to Amsterdam as it was nice, and you could do a lot worse!

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: yank
Reviews.Content: The Owl Hotel, located on a quiet looking street "behind the Marriott" and in the museum district of Amsterdam, offers amenities we've not had before in Europe. It has a comfortable reading room and a great garden patio. We (five adults) had two rooms, both of which were of adequate size and clean. The bathrooms were large. One of the rooms had a screen shade that allowed us to keep the window open on the warm nights without worrying about bugs. The included breakfast was good and the staff helpful. They also provided a fan to help us compensate with the abnormally hot weather Holland was experiencing. The only drawback was the Friday night noise level, especially in the street side room. (On Saturday night, noise wasn't a problem--go figure!!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Owl!”
Reviews.Author: KAQ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Owl at the beginning of May, and would recommend it to anybody. The rooms were fairly small (which is expected in Amsterdam) but spotlessly clean and comfortable. There is a small bar area joined onto reception, serving reasonably priced beer. During our 3 night stay the bar was very quiet and meant that the staff had time to chat and make you feel at home. The hotel also has a lovely patio to the rear, we had lovely weather and it was great to be able to sit outside in the peace and quiet. The Owl is situated on a residential street, and is quiet and out of the way of the main hustle and bustle of the Leidesplain, while being within easy walking distance. It is in a brilliant location. So a lovely hotel with friendly staff and in a great place, weâ€™d go back any time and wouldnâ€™t hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: alucard48
Reviews.Content: Hotel is superb with a welcoming atmosphere, very helpfull staff and a lovely breakfast if a little basic. Rooms are very clean and tidy with fresh linen every day and we had a superb view of the garden. The only problem with this hotel is the distance to the heart of the city. Nearby is the Holland Casino and the Irish bar (one of many) also a hard rock cafe, but too get to Dam square, the red light district and rembrant square which are the main social areas they are quite a walk so i reccomend the trams or bikes. but overall i strongly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, no problems”
Reviews.Author: Travels_too_muchUtah
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nice compromise between a chain hotel and an older hotel with more character closer to town. We had a nice, short stay at the Owl during a 24-hour stopover in between flights from US to Africa. The room was nice and clean, if a bit small. The breakfast is good (except for the coffee) and the staff very polite and helpful. One nice thing is that there's a bar in the hotel if--by some chance--you are unable to find suitable nightlife in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “doublebooking fiasco, but nice and polite staff”
Reviews.Author: hmmmmm
Reviews.Content: I probably am not in a position to write a review of the hotel itself beause I did not get to stay there due to the doublebooking fiasco which the Owl staff had to make up by moving us to another hotel across the street (Liedse). We got SO unhappy when we heard the news from the receptionist. Well, I am not a nice person when I travelled all the way from London, dragging our suitcases all the way to the hotel to be told I can't stay there!! The receptionist was very polite, and he was truly sorry for the doublebooking fiasco because of the hotel.nl website's bug or some sort of glitch on their website which let us reserve the Owl's room when it was actually overbooked. Normally I would not be a nice person when encountering a situation like this. And yet, the way the receptionist was sincere in his apology, as well as fair and efficient in the choice of the alternative hotel, I more than forgive the otherwise terrible mistake in the booking system, and wanted to give the Owl some credit for its ability to damage control with care for the customers. Well, of course if they really cared they wouldn't have that online glitch. But I think it was more than compensated by the way they handled the mistake and accident.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Nolita
Reviews.Content: We requested room 26 as was suggested in other reviews and it was a good size space for a couple, with an adequate bath. It faced the interior courtyard (I imagine summer dining takes place there)and thus was very quiet even when street construction started one morning. The buffet breakfast was more than adequate with ample choice of breads, beverages, cold meats, cheeses, and a variety of spreads. Also boiled eggs, yogurt, cereal/toppings and fresh fruit. As Amsterdam is a relatively small city, the location is very good as we walked to Leidseplein and beyond to shop for food or clothes/gifts; visited major museums nearby and caught a wonderful photo exhibit at the small FOAM gallery. The hotel has a computer with internet which you can access for 15 minutes per one euro. The main door is locked at night but the receptionist is always near the desk to let you in. The staff were all accomodating and helpful including giving us restaurant tips. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TheDoctorG
Reviews.Content: Me & my wife saw in the New Year at the Owl Hotel and found it a great value hotel. Ideal location near Leidseplein, helpful staff & tasty continental breakfast. Our room (54) was small but spotlessly clean and looked out the side of the hotel - a nice view of Vondel Park. For a clean hotel in a good location at good value, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 05. Difficult to find at first it's behind the Marriot Hotel. In a really good location, not in the middle of all the noise but just a few minutes walk from the activity.Our room was v. small as we had our baby with us plus a cot plus a buggy! We asked to get moved to a bigger room as we were there for a week, that was no problem and got a lovely bright room at the front of the hotel. Friendly and helpful staff.Breakfast consists of cereal,bread,cheeses,hams and a lovely chocolate spread! We would definitely go back here.A clean,cheap,basic hotel in a nice area beside Vondel Park.

Reviews.Title: “Just short of Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading all the superlative reviews, we eagerly booked two nights at the Owl. It was somewhat less than what we had expected. On the plus side, the staff was very nice, and the location is fantastic. As several other reviewers noted, the rooms are very small, so we were forewarned. The breakfast, much vaunted in other reviews, was only slightly better than average. It was above a continental, but only barely. My other complaint is probably just a matter of personal preference, but the pillows were HARD. If you are used to a little "give" in your pillows, look out. All in all, the Owl is probably a cut above most other smaller hotels in Europe, but only by a bit.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: MANOFMYSTERY_8
Reviews.Content: I've been to Amsterdam four times since 1984 and have stayed at the Owl each time. It is a very nice and accommodating hotel. The owners continue to upgrade the quality of the building and the service and are always very helpful when addressing my many questions about AMS and the surrounding area. The hotel is very centrally located, but is a bit hard to find at first. It's behind the Marriott Hotel on the Stadhouderskade.

Reviews.Title: “small room but nice visit”
Reviews.Author: Janichic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Owl Hotel for 8 nights recently. My room was tiny, and as it was very hot, it sometimes felt even smaller. (I have stayed in hotels all over the world and this room was the smallest I have ever stayed in) But the hotel was clean, safe, and in a convenient neighborhood which is more important than the size of the room. My room was cleaned and vacuumed every day, the bathroom was immaculate and I had fresh towels every day. The breakfast was excellent and a great deal given the price of breakfasts elsewhere! The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Owl Hotel is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: flyer2212
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Owl Hotel for 4 nights in May/June 2005, and we just loved it. Our room, (a standard double - two single beds pushed together) on the top floor at the back of the hotel, was not large but it was bright and clean, with a modern desk, wardrobe, colour TV, and a spotless bathroom that was positively huge by European standards! The room also had large windows which we could open, as well as a retractable window shade. We had a nice view down to the hotel's little patio and garden below. It was a pleasure to be able to access the garden from the breakfast room - made it feel like we were visiting someone's home! The staff were polite and friendly and were always willing to answer our questions. Our room was cleaned every day and new towels, etc. put out for us. The classic Dutch breakfast consisted of bread, cheese, various cold cuts, coffee and tea, fruit juice, cereal, fruit salad, and boiled eggs, all of it tasty and plentiful; definitely filling enough to fuel our walking trips through Amsterdam! We particularly liked the location of this hotel - close to the Leidseplein in a quiet, treed neighbourhood, yet within easy walking distance of the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, Canal Boat Tours, the Holland Casino, and Vondelpark; trams were also available just a few minutes away near the Leidseplein. If you stay at the Owl, be sure to say hello to their friendly kitty cat, Puck. He's a real charmer. All in all, we found the Owl to be the perfect spot from which to explore Amsterdam, and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Owl-a great find”
Reviews.Author: cw9169
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 11 day stay in Amsterdam's Owl Hotel. Very good room rates. The owners and staff were extremely helpful, pleasant, and professional. The hotel was very neat and clean throughout. The room cleaning and tidying up were very efficient. My wife and I highly recommend this very cozy family run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Owl met all our needs”
Reviews.Author: DumbDog
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at the Owl four nights the 3rd week of February 2005. We arrived at the Hotel after a long overnight flight from Cairo and knew our room wouldn't be ready at 0830 hours, so we just hoped to be able to leave our bags. Wonderfully our room WAS ready, and it was spotless. The bathroom (room 26) was more than spotless, with a powerful shower and lots of hot water. The room size was moderate, but we spent little time in our room. The double was two twins pushed together, but that's not that uncommon in most non-chain smaller hotels we've stayed in in Europe. The location was wonderful, away from the noise of the center of the city, yet close to the museums, Leidesplein (and the trams). We walked everywhere and found wonderful restaurants nearby. Breakfast was fine: bread, cheeses, eggs, meats, coffe, juice, and cereal. Certainly enough to get your day going. We would certainly stay at the Owl again if we're lucky enough to get back to Amsterdam. We took the train from Schipol Airport to Centraal Station for just over 3 Euro per person each way and then hopped either the number 1, 2, or 5 tram from Centraal Station to the stop near the Marriott Hotel. The Owl is on the block behind the huge Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: theFinn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in early Feb 2005. The rooms are standard european size (read: small), but it was very clean and provided all the amenities. The staff was friendly and helpful. They serve the best breakfast you'll find in Europe. It actually had eggs! Overall a great spead! The only complaints I have are that it was a little hard to find (tucked away off a street that is currently under some construction) and they're website doesn't provide very clear instructions. Second, was that the 'double' room came with 2 seperate twin beds pushed together. Thsi would have been fine but they each had their own bedding so it was like my wife and I were sleeping in seperate beds (which we were...). These arn't show stopper issues however, don't hesitate in booking this hotel, we'll be staying there again next time we're in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great, quiet location, but near the excitement!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Owl in mid-December 2004. As we walked from the tram stop, we were surrounded by the hustle and bustle of a very busy part of town (the casino, restaurants, etc.). But as we made the final turn onto the Owl's street, suddenly all was silent. It was just a quaint, quiet residential street. The hotel itself is similar. Typical European, compact room but very clean. Typical Netherlands style breakfast in the dining area. Easy walk (even in winter) to the major museums, etc. Overall very pleasant and a reasonable price. We will almost certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great”
Reviews.Author: triplease
Reviews.Content: I've just spent six nights total, 4 nights in a double room and 2 in a single, at the Owl Hotel. It was just great. The rooms were clean, with private modern bathrooms, lots of heat (important at this time of year) and the beds were really comfortable. The location turned out to be perfect as well and was easy to get to by tram and was in walking distance to the major museums and just about everything else really. The breakfast was good and the breakfast room looks out on to a nice garden. The staff was great too. Very helpful, kind and courteous. It is a small hotel tucked in behind the giant chains and has more of a residential feel. There is also an old black and white cat in residence who likes to spend time mingling with the guests. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to those looking for an alternative to the larger hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AntiquityTraveller
Reviews.Content: I spend five nights at the Owl Hotel in October. Simple but clean rooms. Bathroom has a tub and was clean. Try to ask for a room facing towards their garden. Breakfast includes a selection of hams, cheeeses, breads, cereal and juices. Perfect for starting your day right. The staff is very helpful. The location is close to the museums and 4 minute walk to public transportation, shopping, restaurants, and bars. About a 25 fun walk to the Dam Square. Priced at a very reasonable rate given high hotel prices in Amsterdam.

HotelInfo.Name: Owl Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Roemer Visscherstraat 1, Amsterdam 1054 EV, The Netherlands
